message.content: This question requires basic knowledge of animal characteristics and reproductive methods. Many animals that give birth to live young, such as mammals, have skin. This question requires knowledge about the reproductive characteristics of different animals. Many animals that give birth to live young, such as mammals, have skin. Skin is the external covering of the body in these animals, and it is where their live young develop and grow until birth. Option (B) is incorrect because scales are typically found in animals like reptiles and fish, which lay eggs instead of giving birth to live young. Option (C) is incorrect because exoskeletons are found in animals like insects and crustaceans, which also lay eggs. Option (D) is incorrect because gills are respiratory organs found in aquatic animals, and they are not related to giving birth to live young.
